intro: Pilosella amaurochlora, commonly known as the grayleaf whiteweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in a flat-topped inflorescence, and its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. Pilosella amaurochlora is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters.
